intro: Cyrtandra glabricalycis, commonly known as the smooth-leaved cyrtandra, is a member of the Gesneriaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly Indonesia and the Philippines. This plant is characterized by its glossy, smooth leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as rainforests and mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
